page.title: 10TOFT HALL, TOFT.
page.content: 'TOFT'MEANS 'A PARCEL OF LAND WITH A HOUSE.'EARLIEST RECORDS SHOW THAT LEYCESTER OF TABLEY MARRIED INTO THE TOFT FAMILY,LIVING ON THIS SITE,IN 1390. THE PRESENT HOUSE WAS BUILT IN 1749 AND EXTENDED IN THE EARLY TWENTIETH CENTURY BY THE ARCHITECT,HENRY ROBERTS.THE FAMILY LEFT THE HOUSE SEVENTEEN YEARS AGO FOR ECONOMIC REASONS,BUT RETAINED THE 1,300 ACRE ESTATE.THE PRESENT MR LEYCESTER-ROXBY LIVES AT YEW-TREE FARM. AFTER THE FAMILY LEFT,THE HALL BECAME A NURSING HOME.IT WAS BOUGHT IN JULY 1984 BY NORWEST-HOLST,A BUILDING FIRM,TO BE THEIR HEAD-OFFICE.BEING A LISTED SITE BUILDING,THE ORIGINAL SHELL OF SANDSTONE,RENDERED BRICK AND WELSH BLUE SLATE ROOF WILL BE LEFT AND ONLY THE INTERIOR RECONSTRUCTED. COMPLETION IS EXPECTED BY DEC.1985.
